meanings.definition: In a dirty or unkempt manner.
meanings.sent1: She looked grubbily after playing in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The child's face was grubbily smeared with chocolate.
meanings.sent3: Despite her best efforts, she always ended up grubbily dressed after gardening.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned house stood grubbily at the end of the street, a shadow of its former self.
meanings.sent5: The beggar sat grubbily on the sidewalk, hoping for some spare change.

meanings.sent1: The grubbily hands left marks on the clean wall.
meanings.sent2: The dog returned home grubbily from rolling in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The grubbily cat pawed at the window, leaving smudges behind.
meanings.sent4: The grubbily floor of the barn was a testament to the hardworking farmers.
meanings.sent5: The grubbily street urchin gazed longingly at the bakery window.
